articles.title: CPRK Slams Crackdown upon Progressive Party
articles.content:
CPRK Slams Crackdown upon Progressive Party
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak conservative group of south Korea is working hard to prevent the lawmakers from the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) from advancing into the "National Assembly" (NA), labeling them "pro-north leftists" and "communists following the Juche idea." 
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea observed in its information bulletin No. 999 issued Thursday in this regard:
					
					 The madcap smear campaign kicked off by the puppet conservative group is nothing but a "witch hunt" of modern version and sordid fascist politically-motivated terrorism perpetrated by the pro-U.S. conservative forces to stay in power.
					
					 Many members of the UPP and other progressive forces were elected members of the NA in April, something unprecedented in history. This is a heavy blow at the conservative group including the "Saenuri Party" which faked up at random the pro-U.S. sycophantic and fascist unpopular laws while going unchallenged at the NA after occupying its majority seats, the bulletin noted, and went on:
					
					 The conservative group feels a serious crisis that if the progressive forces occupy the NA, this may arrest its moves for confrontation and war and remarkably increase the atmosphere for reunification through alliance with the north to create the situation unfavorable for keeping its puppet ruling system and seizing the power again.
					
					 The puppet group is deeply interfering into the incident of the UPP and resorting to all intrigues to annihilate the progressive forces and, at the same time, trying to deliberately bar them from advancing into the NA.
					
					 The conservative puppet group is making desperate efforts to create a situation favorable for the conservative forces' stay in power before the "presidential election" this year, availing themselves of this opportunity, by stifling progressive forces and blocking the solidarity among the opposition parties.
					
					 It is nonsensical that the puppet group is branding persons of progressive forces as "red men", insisting that they had "contact with the north" and "received the north's instruction".
					
					 The puppet group's fascist suppression is a most base politically-motivated killing, unprecedented in the world.
					
					 It is none other than such pro-U.S. lackeys, anti-reunification confrontation maniacs, fascists and chief culprits of scandals as the group of the "Saenuri Party" that should be eliminated from the NA.
					
					 The people from all walks of life in south Korea should heighten vigilance against the puppet conservative group's intrigues and fascist repression of the progressive forces, strongly oppose and denounce them, check and frustrate its attempt to stay in power and certainly bring about a new politics and new world with their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Ministry of Railways Delegation Leaves for Azerbaijan
articles.content:
Ministry of Railways Delegation Leaves for Azerbaijan
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Railways led by Minister Jon Kil Su left here Thursday to take part in the 40th ministerial meeting of the Organization of Railways Cooperation to be held in Azerbaijan. 
					 The DPRK players who took part in the 2012 ITTF World Tour, China Open, Shanghai, returned home while the delegation of the State Administration for Industry and Commerce of China led by Vice Minister Fu Shuangjian went back on the same day.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Ri Po Ik
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Ri Po Ik
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of Ri Po Ik, grandmother of President Kim Il Sung, in Mangyongdae on her 136th birth anniversary on Thursday.
					 Seen standing before the grave was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Jong Gak, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Pyong Sam, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and working people in the city.
					
					 Placed before the grave were wreaths in the names of the Central Committee of the WPK, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, military academies, educational and media organs and party and power bodies and farms in Pyongyang City.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to her, looking back on the noble life of her who gave steady continuity to the patriotic Mangyongdae revolutionary family tradition and devoted her all to the accomplishment of the sacred cause for the country and its people.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador Liu Hongcai Thursday hosted a reception at his embassy in memory of leader Kim Jong Il's visits to China in 2010 and 2012. 
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Ki Nam and Kim Yong Il, secretaries of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Song Nam, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Hyong Jun, vice foreign minister of the DPRK and officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the Chinese embassy attended.
					
					 Liu in his speech at the reception said that entering the new century General Secretary Kim Jong Il together with the Chinese leaders developed onto a new higher stage the traditional friendship between the two countries provided by the revolutionaries of the elder generation.
					
					 His historic visits to China laid the firm foundation for boosting the bilateral relations and made positive contribution to the regional peace and stability, Liu noted, stressing that the feats performed by Kim Jong Il in boosting the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations will be everlasting.
					
					 Liu sincerely wished the Korean people fresher achievements in the work to successfully carry out the behests of Kim Jong Il under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam in his speech said the supreme leaders of the two countries reached common understanding of the issue of boosting the friendship between the DPRK and China generation after generation.
					
					 He hoped that the Chinese people would make greater advance in their cause of building socialism with Chinese characteristics under the guidance of the Communist Party of China and greet the 18th Party Congress with success.
					
					 He expressed his belief that the traditional DPRK-China friendship would invariably grow stronger by the joint efforts of the two parties and peoples.

articles.title: World No Tobacco Day Observed
articles.content:
World No Tobacco Day Observed
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday to mark World No Tobacco Day.
					 Present at the event were officials of public health, ministries, national institutions and public organizations and working people in Pyongyang City.
					
					 Staff members of the mission of the WHO here were also present there.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The speakers said that World No Tobacco Day serves as an effective occasion for tabling various issues arising in no smoking activities, seeking ways for solution and raising social concern about it.
					
					 The member nations of the WHO should be concerned about the tobacco industry to control the tobacco production, sale, commercials and others to protect the people's health from smoking, they stressed.
					
					 The participants watched a video related to no smoking.
					
					 And they enjoyed a quiz and a performance by members of students' art squad on controlling tobacco.

articles.title: Enforcement of Tobacco Control Law in DPRK
articles.content:
Enforcement of Tobacco Control Law in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has pushed ahead with the work to enforce the tobacco control law in order to prevent the aftereffects of smoking on health, environment and economic life.
					 Pak Myong Su, head of the State Sanitary Inspection Board under the Ministry of Public Health, told KCNA:
					
					 "The tobacco control law of the DPRK was adopted in July Juche 94 (2005) and revised in December 2009.
					
					 The law specifies the regulations and policies on tobacco control, including articles that call for fixing smoking places and keeping them clean in a hygienic way and banning ads on tobacco."
					
					 Seminars and workshops have taken place in a planned manner to enforce the tobacco control law.
					
					 A seminar on prevention and control of non-contagious diseases held in August last year discussed multi-faceted cooperation over the issues arising in prohibiting smoking.
					
					 Non-smoking research centers, built in the capital city of Pyongyang and two provinces, are conducting their brisk activities, including research and development of no-tobacco goods and consultation with smokers.
					
					 TV, radio and other media of the country give wide publicity to harmfulness of tobacco and importance of non-smoking campaign on World No-Tobacco Day (May 31) every year. Also, a work is going on to print and disseminate literatures on non-smoking.
					
					 On the occasion of World No-Tobacco Day this year, various events took place in Pyongyang under the theme of "Tobacco Industry Interference" set by the World Health Organization. They included an action of explaining about the tobacco control law to be abided by tobacco producers.

articles.title: Kaesong City, Seized with Festive Mood
articles.content:
Kaesong City, Seized with Festive Mood
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Kaesong City, adjacent to the Military Demarcation Line, has been put in an ecstasy of joy with appointments of delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union.
					 Hwangbo Su Hyon (43), father of Hwangbo Song (11), a delegate to the celebrations, told KCNA:
					
					 "I am a special-class disabled soldier. My family has enjoyed benefits from the Party and the State.
					
					 And, this time my daughter, Song, was appointed a KCU delegate. I can hardly express my feelings now. Such loving care will become a memory to be shared by my family through generations."
					
					 Kim Myong Gwang (13), a student at Koryo Secondary School, said in tears:
					
					 "I am not an orphan for I regard the dear respected Kim Jong Un as my own father."
					
					 An officer of the Korean People's Army, Kim Chol Ung, father of Kim Ung (10), a pupil at Manwol Primary School, said:
					
					 "Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un inspected the military outpost in Panmunjom I was standing guard in March this year and showed deep trust in our service personnel.
					
					 And, my son is to go to Pyongyang as a KCU delegate to the celebrations. Now I feel my family has got all blessings."
					
					 Farmers Ri Wan Song and Kim Pong Sil, father and mother of Ri Jin Du (11), a student at Panmunjom Secondary School, said that they would work harder to boost grain output, inspired by their son's appointment as a delegate.

articles.title: Acrobatic Performance Prepared Exclusively for KCU Delegates
articles.content:
Acrobatic Performance Prepared Exclusively for KCU Delegates
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Circus is busy with preparations for acrobatic performance to be given for the delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU.)
					 Song Yong Hyok, deputy head in charge of the arts of the Circus, told KCNA:
					
					 "The KCU delegates represent the rosy future of the country.
					
					 The Pyongyang Circus, well-known to the world, will soon give a special performance in honor of them celebrating the KCU anniversary. All its acrobats are excited with the news that they are to perform for the children, the king of Songun Korea.
					
					 The performance program was finally set a few days ago. It includes aerial stunts 'Flying Girls' and 'Fliers' and physical acrobatics 'Playing with Pole' and 'Balancing Etude on the Desk.' Comic and animal feats, too, have been created to suit the schoolchildren's features."
					
					 Kim Chun Ae, a Merited Actress, said:
					
					 "I am on a tiptoe of excitement with our performance for the little delegates approaching. The performance will be a happy time for me if we get applause from them."
					
					 Ro Sok Hyon, a 19-year-old student of Pyongyang Acrobatic School, said he would do his utmost in the performance to delight the delegates.

articles.title: Children's Rights Fully Ensured in DPRK
articles.content:
Children's Rights Fully Ensured in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- It is a consistent policy of the government of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to give importance to the children and fully ensure their rights and interests.
					 The DPRK government has given preference to ensuring children's rights in education, health care, family life and other fields. 
					
					Each child enjoys equal rights irrespective of family background, sex, jobs of parents or guardians, property relations and physical defect.
					
					 Children get to be mentally and morally sound in good health under the universal 11-year free compulsory education system and the universal free medical care system.
					
					 They can get after-school education in accordance with their talents. Branch schools operate even in remote mountainous areas and solitary islets.
					
					 Disabled children enjoy the same rights as others do. 
					
					Children, with no parents and guardians, are settled in baby homes, orphanages and schools for bereaved children.
					
					 "Best things to children!" this is what the DPRK government has maintained in its policy-making.

articles.title: Fundamental Different Fates of Children in North and South
articles.content:
Fundamental Different Fates of Children in North and South
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- How to bring up the younger generation is an important issue on which hinges the nation's future.
					 The lifeline of the revolution is carried forward by the younger generation and the future of the country hinges on them.
					
					 Therefore, the DPRK has spared nothing for the younger generation, deeming it as a mainstay to bring them up well from long ago. 
					
					 It is in pursuance of this policy to celebrate June 6, the holiday of the Korean Children's Union, as a great event to be recorded in the history of the country.
					
					 Brisk preparations have been made for the celebrations under the deep care of the party, the state and all the people.
					
					 Pyongyang is ready to welcome 20,000 delegates including exemplary KCU members from all primary and secondary schools and their branches across the country. 
					
					 Arrangements for diverse events have already been wound up. 
					
					 Famous national art troupes have good programs for concerts and other art performances. The Kaeson Youth Park Funfair, the Central Zoo, Okryu Restaurant, Chongryu Restaurant, etc. are fully ready to welcome the delegates. 
					
					 The coming month of June will be crowded with unprecedentedly significant events in which the children will enjoy blessings of the whole country. 
					
					 This is the fruition of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's noblest idea of giving importance to the future as he has carried forward the ennobling outlook of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on the younger generation.
					
					 The DPRK is the only country in the world which projects the children as its kings and has consistently enforced a policy of preferential treatment of younger generation in all parts of it. 
					
					 The DPRK has attached importance to the education of the younger generation, enforcing free education from primary schools to universities.
					
					 It is under this loving care that the schoolchildren in the DPRK are now firmly preparing themselves as knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy pillars of Songun Korea. 
					
					 The reality of south Korea is quite different from the above-said reality in the DPRK.
					
					 According to the opinion poll made by the Institute for Juvenile Policy Studies among more than 9 400 students of primary, middle and high schools on their social outlook, 50 percent of the respondents said they wished to live in foreign countries.
					
					 At a time when juvenile crimes have become a serious social problem, the number of those children who left their houses or stopped going to school has rapidly increased to reach about 80,000 since the Lee Myung Bak regime emerged.
					
					 According to a survey of school violence made by the puppet Ministry of Education, Science and Technology among students of primary, middle and high schools in south Korea, 167,395 victims said they were exposed to violence at schools. 
					
					 Suicides held the biggest proportion among the teenage casualties in south Korea.
					
					 The puppet educational authorities are deploring that the rate of suicide is higher than casualties claimed by traffic incidents, diseases and crimes. Economic difficulties, the problem in entering schools of higher grade and rampant violence, etc. are the main causes of juvenile suicides.  
					
					 Unable to bear all sorts of pressures, a product of social evils, teenagers give up their wishes to enter schools of higher grade and hope for the future. In the end they take their own lives, cursing the society unfit for human habitation.
					
					 Even educational officials concerned in south Korea said:
					
					 "Youngsters choose to commit suicides, giving up their growth and lives. This bespeaks that there is a very serious problem in the present system".
					
					 These are the fundamentally different realities in the north and the south of Korea.

articles.title: DPRK Will Force Japan to Pay for Blood Shed: KCNA
articles.content:
DPRK Will Force Japan to Pay for Blood Shed: KCNA
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that the Japanese imperialists hurled the Koreans who were taken to Japan for forced labor to battlefields during World War II, touching off people's resentment.
					According to testimony made by the former commander of defense corps of the Imperial Japanese Army, the Japanese imperialists forced the Koreans to dash into the U.S. tanks with explosives on their backs when the U.S. army was landing on Okinawa in 1945. Over 10,000 drafted Koreans were forced to fight against the U.S. army.
					
					 This brought to light another segment of the crimes the Japanese imperialists committed against the Korean people last century.
					
					 The "Okinawa murder case" was an atrocity committed by brutes without an equal to exterminate the Korean nation and the most hideous crime against humanity that can hardly be found in the history of the imperialists' aggression.
					
					 As already known to the world, tens of thousands of innocent people lost their lives during the U.S. army's landing on Okinawa.
					
					 Human scum of political circles including the emperor's family and the military used Koreans as "human shields" to save their dirty lives.
					
					 Not content with this, the Japanese imperialists, brutal vampire, forced the Koreans to carry explosives on their backs, pushing them to death.
					
					 There are anecdotes in history that slaves were forced to fight with swords and shields in battles. However, the world knows no such barbarians as the Japanese imperialists who offered Koreans "as sacrifice" in battles in a bid to prolong their remaining days in the wake of depriving the Korean nation of its national rights.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists, to avenge their defeat, exploded "Ukishima-maru" and buried at sea en masse the drafted Koreans who were working at a factory of the Mitsubishi Heavy Industry Company. This was a height of their moves to exterminate the Korean nation.
					
					 This clearly proves once again that Japan is the sworn enemy of Koreans with whom they can never live under the same sky.
					
					 What is more enraging is that the Japanese reactionaries are marking desperate efforts to bury their massacre into oblivion of history.
					
					 They have put all sorts of unreasonable pressure on a documentary film producer who disclosed the said fact and concealed the truth for two decades since the commander of the defense corps made the testimony.
					
					 The crimes against humanity perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists against Koreans are so tremendous that the Japanese reactionaries can hardly cover up their past blood-stained history.
					
					 Still resounding through mountains and rivers are the outcries made by those who were mercilessly killed in Japan, island country, at the hands of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 With nothing can Japan hide its crime-woven past.
					
					 The Japanese government should honestly apologize for its past crimes and make reparations for them.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will certainly force Japan to pay thousand-fold prices for all damage it inflicted upon Koreans and the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Army Officer Accuses Traitor Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
S. Korean Army Officer Accuses Traitor Lee Myung Bak
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- A captain of the south Korean puppet army posted articles critical of traitor Lee Myung Bak on Internet websites, sparking off public furor, according to south Korean media including KBS on May 29.
					 It is reported that the captain posted such articles on Internet websites several times since December last year, in token of a protest against unpopular policy of the present regime.
					
					 The puppet group deliberately linked him to the Unified Progressive Party, an opposition party, to intensify suppression, saying it would severely punish him.
					
					 In this regard, the south Korean people from different social standings are voicing protest against the authorities' unreasonable threat and suppression of those who raised just demand and violation of freedom of expression.

articles.title: Joint Struggle for Right to Existence Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint Struggle for Right to Existence Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- More than 2,000 unionists of the Construction Trade Union and Freight Workers' Solidarity under the Confederation of Trade Unions of south Korea held a meeting in Youido, Seoul on May 29 and declared that they would stage a joint struggle to achieve the right to existence. 
					 The speakers said that the workers' real income is below the lowest living expenses.
					
					 The business enterprises fall short of providing the workers with salaries, pushing them to the abyss of death, they deplored.
					
					 The workers in the fields of construction and freight would launch a joint general strike against the "government" and capitalists, they said.

articles.title: DUP Criticizes Conservative Group for Its Greed for Power
articles.content:
DUP Criticizes Conservative Group for Its Greed for Power
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic United Party of south Korea (DUP), an opposition party, called a press conference at the "National Assembly" building on May 29 to denounce the conservative group greedy for power.
					 Recalling that the "Saenuri Party" led by Park Geun Hye laid its foundation with the forces praising the military coup staged by Park Chung-Hee, the spokesman said:
					
					 All those involved in it are the guys who glutted themselves and dressed gaudily by dint of power in the period of military dictatorial regime. Their return to power would be another tragedy, political tragedy.
					
					 It is the people's thought that unfortunate past should not be made to repeat, the spokesman noted, calling for not allowing those praising dictatorship to take power.

articles.title: Democratic Congo Personage Gives Impressions of DPRK
articles.content:
Democratic Congo Personage Gives Impressions of DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo and chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, gave impressions of his visit to the DPRK in Kinshasa on May 18.
					 He keenly felt during his stay in Pyongyang that the dear respected Kim Jong Un was enjoying the absolute support and trust from the army and people of the DPRK, he noted, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un's speech in the military parade in celebration of the 100th Day of the Sun left great impression on all the audience and waves of jubilation and emotion swept Kim Il Sung Square.
					
					 The celebrations displayed to the full the unanimous will of the party, army and people of the DPRK to uphold President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal sun of Juche and the political, economic and military might of Songun Korea.
					
					 He got to know through the visit to Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp that there is prospering DPRK thanks to Kim Il Sung who fought 20-year long anti-Japanese war and Kim Jong Il who successfully inherited the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Their ideas and exploits would be given a steady continuity and the revolutionary cause of Juche is sure to triumph under the sagacious leadership of Kim Jong Un over the army and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in Romania
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in Romania
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" was held at the building of the Socialist Party of Romania on May 21.
					 Present at the seminar were the personages of the Socialist Party of Romania and groups for the study of the Juche idea of Romania and the masses. The DPRK ambassador to Romania and his embassy staff were present on invitation.
					
					 The chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Bucharest referred to the content of the work.
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the party, at the seminar praised leader Kim Jong Il as a great strategist, master of ideology and theory and defender of socialism who successfully led the Korean people's struggle to defend socialism and build a thriving nation.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un has shown the disposition of a thinker and theoretician in various works including his speech at the military parade.
					
					 Reflected in those works was his firm conviction and will to achieve the cause of building a thriving nation by successfully inheriting the ideas and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We are confident the Korean people would surely triumph in the construction of the thriving socialist country, desire of Kim Jong Il, upholding the idea and intention of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Bright Future of DPRK Seen on Faces of Children: Foreigners
articles.content:
Bright Future of DPRK Seen on Faces of Children: Foreigners
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Foreigners who visited the DPRK expressed admiration at the children who are stoutly growing up to be the masters of the future.
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, visited the Kim Jong Suk Nursery. The future of the DPRK is bright and its socialist system is the most popular one, he said, and went on: 
					
					 It is only in the DPRK where such a wonderful nursery was built for children and necessary conditions are provided. It puts forward children as the king of the country and spares nothing for them. 
					
					 The visit helped me know well about the noble outlook of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un on the younger generation.
					
					 Sumiko Shimizu, representative of the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women, visiting the Changgwang Kindergarten, said she was deeply moved by the fact that children are growing up at the state expenses. 
					
					 Sysay Leudedmounsone, president of the Central Committee of the Lao Women's Union, noted that she was deeply impressed with Korean children singing and dancing to their heart's content.
					
					 Mustafa Al Safarini, chairman of the Arab Information Center in China, praised the socialist education system of the DPRK which is enforcing the free compulsory education from kindergarten. Seeing stout and cheerful children, I could picture the bright future of the DPRK which would more prosper, he noted.

articles.title: S. Korea Exposed Its Weakness: Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
S. Korea Exposed Its Weakness: Foreign Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Peruvian organizations issued statements on May 22 and 23 in support of the statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Ministry of Post and Telecommunications.
					 The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship said that the south Korean puppet group said this or that over the jamming that swept south Korea and later kicked up the anti-DPRK racket for no reason. It noted: Such provocation reminded one of the Cheonan warship case in which the south Korean group intended to deceive the world people, only to be ridiculed. 
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the south Korean wave system is the U.S. technology. South Korea self-exposed its scientific and technological weakness and abused its master by making fuss about jamming. We denounce the south Korean puppet clique for its provocation.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea said: The south Korean authorities took issue with the DPRK. It was a product of their persistent hostile policy toward the DPRK. Through the burlesque they fully revealed the scientific and technological vulnerability unable to properly probe the cause of jamming and prevent the damage beforehand. The whole world is now spitting at their provocation which is consistent with lies and fabrications.
					
					 The DPRK will shatter all provocation moves of them and other enemies and advance toward the victory of the socialist cause. 
					
					 We express invariable support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to build a thriving nation and realize national reunification.

articles.title: China Issues "Human Rights Record of the US in 2011"
articles.content:
China Issues "Human Rights Record of the US in 2011"
 Beijing, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Information Office of the State Council of China on May 25 released the "Human Rights Record of the United States in 2011" in response to the "Country Reports on Human Rights Practices for 2011" issued by the U.S. State Department. 
					 The China's report said: "The U.S. report is full of overly critical remarks on human rights conditions in nearly 200 countries and regions, as well as distortions and accusations concerning human rights causes in China. However, the U.S. has turned a blind eye to its own woeful human rights situation and remained silent about it."
					
					 "The United States' own tarnished human rights record has made it in no condition, on moral, political or legal basis, to act as the world's human rights justice," it stressed.

articles.title: Russia Slashes US on Its Human Rights Report
articles.content:
Russia Slashes US on Its Human Rights Report
 Moscow, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry's representative for human rights, democracy and law on May 28 slashed the U.S. over its human rights report whose the part concerning Russia is not objective.
					 He noted that like other similar papers the report "contains the habitual abuse of the humanitarian and human rights issues, use of double standards, arbitrary assessments in favor of the U.S. political interests."
					
					 He disclosed that it is not certain that the part is based on any fact adding that what is important is that the analysis of the human rights situation in the U.S. is not mentioned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Almacen para Ninos y nuevas viviendas en Changjon
articles.content:
CPRK Slams Crackdown upon Progressive Party
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak conservative group of south Korea is working hard to prevent the lawmakers from the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) from advancing into the "National Assembly" (NA), labeling them "pro-north leftists" and "communists following the Juche idea." 
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea observed in its information bulletin No. 999 issued Thursday in this regard:
					
					 The madcap smear campaign kicked off by the puppet conservative group is nothing but a "witch hunt" of modern version and sordid fascist politically-motivated terrorism perpetrated by the pro-U.S. conservative forces to stay in power.
					
					 Many members of the UPP and other progressive forces were elected members of the NA in April, something unprecedented in history. This is a heavy blow at the conservative group including the "Saenuri Party" which faked up at random the pro-U.S. sycophantic and fascist unpopular laws while going unchallenged at the NA after occupying its majority seats, the bulletin noted, and went on:
					
					 The conservative group feels a serious crisis that if the progressive forces occupy the NA, this may arrest its moves for confrontation and war and remarkably increase the atmosphere for reunification through alliance with the north to create the situation unfavorable for keeping its puppet ruling system and seizing the power again.
					
					 The puppet group is deeply interfering into the incident of the UPP and resorting to all intrigues to annihilate the progressive forces and, at the same time, trying to deliberately bar them from advancing into the NA.
					
					 The conservative puppet group is making desperate efforts to create a situation favorable for the conservative forces' stay in power before the "presidential election" this year, availing themselves of this opportunity, by stifling progressive forces and blocking the solidarity among the opposition parties.
					
					 It is nonsensical that the puppet group is branding persons of progressive forces as "red men", insisting that they had "contact with the north" and "received the north's instruction".
					
					 The puppet group's fascist suppression is a most base politically-motivated killing, unprecedented in the world.
					
					 It is none other than such pro-U.S. lackeys, anti-reunification confrontation maniacs, fascists and chief culprits of scandals as the group of the "Saenuri Party" that should be eliminated from the NA.
					
					 The people from all walks of life in south Korea should heighten vigilance against the puppet conservative group's intrigues and fascist repression of the progressive forces, strongly oppose and denounce them, check and frustrate its attempt to stay in power and certainly bring about a new politics and new world with their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita establecimientos para ninos en avenida Changjon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Almacen para Ninos y nuevas viviendas en Changjon
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el Almacen para Ninos y las viviendas construidos en la capitalina avenida Changjon.
					En primer lugar, estuvo en el Almacen para Ninos a punto de inaugurarse.
					
					Se entero del estado de construccion visitando varios puntos del almacen desde su primer piso hasta el tercero.
					
					Se mostro satisfecho de que los constructores hayan terminado con exito en un corto plazo esa enorme obra teniendo presente el noble proposito del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il quienes presentaron a los ninos como reyes del pais y prestaron siempre profunda atencion para que ellos crezcan sin tener nada que envidiar en el mundo.
					
					El almacen esta situado en este lugar magnifico frente a la colina Mansu, donde estan erguidas las estatuas de bronce del Presidente y el Dirigente quienes amaban a los ninos mas que nadie, dijo y dio valiosas instrucciones que se presentan en la administracion del almacen.
					
					Averiguando las medidas para garantizar las mercancias para la infancia, enseno que se debe mejorar incesantemente el servicio para los ninos, ya que se ha edificado este moderno almacen a las alturas del nuevo siglo.
					
					Subrayo que la tarea de especial importancia es producir mucho y suministrar los juguetes de inteligencia que contribuyan al desarrollo intelectual de ninos y hagan a estos comprender los principios cientificos.
					
					Es muy extensa la superficie del almacen, senalo e instruyo construir quioscos y el area de recreo bajo techo para ninos.
					
					Las dependientes del almacen expresaron agradecimiento a Kim Jong Un por haber hecho construir el moderno almacen y haberlo visitado aunque esta muy ocupado.
					
					El les respondio que tales palabras de gratitud le hacen redoblar la decision de trabajar con abnegacion para los ninos coreanos que constituyen el futuro de la patria.
					
					Acto seguido, el recorrio las viviendas construidas nuevamente en la avenida Changjon.
					
					Dando vueltas largamente por varias casas de los edificios no. 6 y no. 1, se entero del estado de construccion.
					
					Pasando revista al interior de las viviendas construidas en diversas formas, se cercioro del tamano de habitaciones, el uso de fregador de la cocina y las condiciones de ventilacion en el deposito.
					
					Estan bien disenadas las nuevas viviendas, incluyendo las del edificio no.1, y se llevo a cabo en alto nivel la ejecucion de ellas, dijo y reconocio los meritos de los constructores.
					
					Al final, presento las tareas importantes que serviran de guia en acondicionar esta capital conforme a las exigencias de la epoca del Songun.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Jang Song Thaek, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Ri Jae Il, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y Ryang Chong Song, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae recorre Centro Deportivo de Avenida Thongil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita establecimientos para ninos en avenida Changjon
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Escuela Primaria de Changjon, la Casa Cuna de Kyongsang y el Jardin de Infancia de Kyongsang, recien construidos en la avenida Changjon. 
					Ante todo, el Maximo Dirigente visito la Escuela Primaria de Changjon. 
					
					Estuvo primero en el sitio reservado para levantar la estatua de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung y entro en la sala de presentacion del historial. 
					
					Viendo los datos historicos, se informo de que la doble Heroina del Trabajo, Kim Su Bok, directora de la escuela, quien habia dado una clase de lengua materna en presencia del Presidente, trabaja durante 58 anos como maestra y directora en la misma escuela, aprecio los esfuerzos de ella quien dedica toda su vida a la formacion de las generaciones venideras. 
					
					Pasando por las aulas desde la primera planta hasta la cuarta, pregunto donde se han hecho los pupitres y sillas y dijo que estos inmuebles son adecuados a la edad y estatura de los alumnos. 
					
					Cuando pasaba por el corredor, instruyo colocar ahi el banco con perchas para que los alumnos puedan colgar sus abrigos e impermeables mojados en el invierno y la temporada de lluvias. 
					
					Se puso contento de la calidad de las salas de estudio de lenguas extranjeras y computacion.
					
					Llegado al auditorio, dijo muy complacido que a los maestros y alumnos les gustaria mucho este salon ancho.
					
					Interrumpio sus pasos de partida para ver el patio deportivo de la escuela y enseno minuciosamente los problemas para acondicionarlo mejor.
					
					Pregunto donde estudian ahora los alumnos de esta escuela en construccion. Y al recibir el parte de que la escuela abrira pronto las puertas, prometio volver a visitarla para ver a los alumnos estudiando. Luego, el Maximo Dirigente visito la Casa Cuna de Kyongsang.
					
					En el grupo no.2 de lactantes, averiguo la posibilidad de adecuar las temperaturas de la habitacion a la crianza de bebes tambien en las condiciones de invierno y examino si penetra o no el aire por la ventana de balcon. 
					
					En la sala de comer, puso la mano en el suelo para sopesar el estado de calefaccion y encomendo procurar que los ninos coman en la habitacion provista de hipocausto.
					
					Durante el recorrido por las salas de educacion y la de juegos-inteligencia, dijo que los inmuebles y las instalaciones han sido distribuidos bien conforme al estado psiquico de la poblacion infantil. 
					
					Apunto la necesidad de prestar siempre profunda atencion a la formacion correcta de los ninos, futuro de la patria, e instruyo a las nineras de la guarderia atenderlos con amor maternal. 
					
					Por ultimo, Kim Jong Un recorrio el Jardin de Infancia de Kyongsang. 
					
					En el patio del jardin, dijo que los ninos juguetones pueden sufrir lesiones si el patio es pavimentado totalmente, y agrego que se debe acondicionarlo como area de cesped de forma circular.
					
					Llegado a la sala de presentacion de historial, escucho con satisfaccion el reporte de que bajo la guia y atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el jardin de infancia complacio en varias ocasiones a el al formar a muchos talentos musicales mediante la intensificacion de la educacion necesaria al desarrollo intelectual y al mejoramiento de vocacion cultural de los ninos. 
					
					En la sala de juego del segundo piso, la califico de magnifica y adecuada a la mentalidad infantil elogiando la calidad del diseno hecho en el Instituto de Disenos Urbanos de Pyongyang.
					
					Pasando revista a todas las salas de cada piso, expreso reiteradamente su satisfaccion diciendo que esta visita le pone mas contento y le gusta lo todo del jardin de infancia. 
					
					Estamos muy ocupados, pero nos esperan los ninos que prepararon una funcion artistica, dijo y dedico su valioso tiempo a ver ese espectaculo en el auditorio del primer piso. 
					
					Terminada la funcion, llamo a nino solista y le vertio alabanzas luego de abrazarlo y preguntarle la edad y la profesion de sus padres. 
					
					Sentado en la escena, tomo una foto de recuerdo con los ninos. 
					
					Respondio carinosamente al saludo de despedida de los ninos y prometio a los funcionarios visitar otra vez sin falta este jardin de infancia para reunirse con todos los ninos de aqui.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente fue acompanado en esta ocasion por Jang Song Thaek, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Ri Jae Il, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ryang Chong Song y Pak Chun Hong, subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Celebran en Corea el Dia Mundial de No Fumar
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae recorre Centro Deportivo de Avenida Thongil
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio la vispera el Centro Deportivo de Avenida Thongil.
					Gracias a la iniciativa y el proyecto del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, el centro se construyo modernamente en una vasta superficie de terreno para el fomento de la salud del pueblo coreano y esta en visperas de su inauguracion.
					
					Consta de las salas de rehabilitacion de salud, la sala de ping pong, la piscina ultrasonica y otras con cientos de instalaciones deportivas de diversa especie.
					
					Choe paso revista a varios puntos del centro donde estan impregnadas las nobles huellas de amor al pueblo del Comandante Supremo del EPC.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de materializar estrictamente los constructores el caracter popular en la obra guardando profundamente el proposito del Comandante Supremo de ofrecer la opulencia socialista a los habitantes.
					
					En todas las instalaciones deportivas esta impregnado el caluroso amor del Comandante Supremo, senalo Choe y asevero que se debe asegurar al maximo la comodidad del pueblo al mantenerlas bien.
					
					Recorriendo la carniceria que contribuira a la vida alimentaria del pueblo, Choe puntualizo que los funcionarios y servidores deben cumplir su responsabilidad y papeles al tener presente sus deberes como servidores del pueblo levantando en alto la consigna del PTC "!Servir al Pueblo!".
					
					Exhorto a los constructores militares culminar la obra en el corto tiempo al materializar estrictamente la orden del Comandante Supremo.
